text: This recording is from the British Council.
I think it went quite well. I did a lot of research and prepared a lot. I was in there for... I don't know. Half an hour?
Nothing much. At the end I asked them what happens now and the woman said will call.
And you're back with news in 3 or 4 days.
Really? Yeah. I think I've got the job.
There weren't a lot of other people there. I was the...
Oh yeah, let's see. Yes, so I was in the museum and there were, I don't know, 100 people wait.
and I try to see them on a Lisa.
But I couldn't look at it. Why not? Because the room was filled with people taking photographs of it. Oh, right. Yes.
selfies. Wait a minute, you can take photos while you're in there.
Yes, but you can't use flash, I don't know. Why do we take photos of everything we see when we travel?
I know, and we never look at the photos after.
photos. I don't feel I'm enjoying things.
I can't remember. Umm... What am I doing? You're sitting on the sofa watching TV and eating chocolates. Nothing changes.
Very funny. You look very younger. I know.
Look at my hair! I was so long!
Mine too. Look at me. Hey, I think I know who took this photo.

No, it wasn't dad or mum. Do you remember Barry? No. Yes, yes, you do remember. Barry, your boyfriend at high school? You were 17 and he was 16 and he was so very polite. Hello, I'm Barry. It's very nice to meet you.
Yeah, well, he took the photo. D.
I'm glad we could talk about this.

Now, what the hell? Why you turning back first? It is done. No, I can't see it. Is it ok? or vomiting? Is this poison or plastics? It can't be use, is it? Can do it! But, it's eggshells. I can't stop thinking could matter. That's nothing to tell.
What do you mean? You know, I'm always in a group with you.
It's just that this time, this time we made the group differently and because you were late.
See, you don't want me in the group.
No, no, it isn't that. It's that we've already made the group see. There's four of us already.
So we can't be a group of five.
people paired root. Ugh. It's not about...
you or your work or anything like that. It's...
So I have to find another group.
This recording is from the British Council. To find more activities to practice your English, visit www.britishcouncil.org.
